title: Candy factory

multiple-choice.question: What is the definition of similar triangles?

options.label: A
options.text: Triangles that have the same size and shape.

options.label: B
options.text: Triangles that have the same shape but not necessarily the same size.

options.label: C
options.text: Triangles that have different shapes and sizes.

options.label: D
options.text: Triangles that have the same angles but different sides.

multiple-choice.question: What is a key property of similar triangles?

options.label: A
options.text: Corresponding angles are equal and corresponding sides are in proportion.

options.label: B
options.text: Corresponding angles are not equal and corresponding sides are in proportion.

options.label: C
options.text: Corresponding angles are equal but corresponding sides are not in proportion.

options.label: D
options.text: Corresponding angles are not equal and corresponding sides are not in proportion.

multiple-choice.question: What is the SAS similarity criterion?

options.label: A
options.text: If two triangles have two pairs of corresponding sides in proportion and the included angles are equal, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: B
options.text: If two triangles have three pairs of corresponding sides in proportion, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: C
options.text: If two triangles have two pairs of corresponding sides in proportion but the included angles are not equal, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: D
options.text: If two triangles have three pairs of corresponding sides in proportion but the included angles are not equal, then the triangles are similar.

multiple-choice.question: What is the SSS similarity criterion?

options.label: A
options.text: If two triangles have two pairs of corresponding sides in proportion, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: B
options.text: If two triangles have three pairs of corresponding sides in proportion, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: C
options.text: If two triangles have two pairs of corresponding sides in proportion but the included angles are not equal, then the triangles are similar.

options.label: D
options.text: If two triangles have three pairs of corresponding sides in proportion but the included angles are not equal, then the triangles are similar.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between similar triangles and congruent triangles?

options.label: A
options.text: Similar triangles have the same size and shape, while congruent triangles have different sizes but the same shape.

options.label: B
options.text: Similar triangles have the same shape but not necessarily the same size, while congruent triangles have the same size and shape.

options.label: C
options.text: Similar triangles have different shapes and sizes, while congruent triangles have the same size and shape.

options.label: D
options.text: Similar triangles have the same angles but different sides, while congruent triangles have the same sides but different angles.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ratio of the lengths of corresponding sides in similar triangles?

options.label: A
options.text: The ratio is not necessarily the same.

multiple-choice.question: What is the application of similar triangles in real-world scenarios?
What is the key concept of similar triangles in mathematics?

options.label: A
options.text: Corresponding angles are equal and corresponding sides are in proportion.

options.label: B
options.text: Corresponding angles are not equal and corresponding sides are in proportion.

options.label: C
options.text: Corresponding angles are equal but corresponding sides are not in proportion.

options.label: D
options.text: Corresponding angles are not equal and corresponding sides are not in proportion.

multiple-choice.question: What is the property of similar triangles that is used to determine if two triangles are similar?

options.label: C
options.text: Both SAS and SSS similarity criteria.

options.label: D
options.text: Neither SAS nor SSS similarity criteria.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of applying the SAS similarity criterion to two triangles?
